        Our Office
        Location IconHolt 381530-898-4335Dr. Cynthia Daley, Founder, DirectorDr. Timothy LaSalle, Co-FounderEmail Usregenerativeag@csuchico.eduCurrent page:  CRA
                                        
    		Welcome to the Future of Agriculture
    	In the face of global climate change, we at the CSU, Chico Center for Regenerative Agriculture and Resilient Systems (CRA) seek to promote regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gasses, restore soil resiliency, increase the sustainability of farms and ranches, and address food and water insecurity.
                        Learn About the Soil Carbon Accrual Project
                    
                    		    		
    		                A multi year, multi-location research and demonstration project measuring the results of regenerative agriculture on soil carbon accrual and restoration using multiple forms of assessment.
    
                        About CRARS
                    
                    		    		
    		                Who we are, what we do, why we exist, how we plan to change the world.
    
                        RA101
                    
                    		    		
    		                The basics of Regenerative Agriculture and how to get started.
    
                        Carbon Farming
                    
                    		    		
    		                Farming proactively with the carbon cycle in mind.
    
                        Events
                    
                    		    		
    		                See past events and learn about upcoming events.
    
                        Regenerative Agriculture Network Web Forum
                    
                    		    		
    		                A group for interacting with other members of our community including farmers, scientists, etc.
    
                        Educational Programs in RA at Chico State
                    Be a Leader in the Field of Regenerative Agriculture.
                        North Valley Food Hub for Climate-Smart Agriculture
                     Training, education and marketing services for small and underserved farmers and ranchers engaging in climate-smart production practices 
                        Regional Conservation Partnership Program
                    
                    		    		
    		                The RCPP helps provide funding for designing and implementing conservation plans for ranchers, farmers, and forest property owners as well as for technical assistance to succeed.
    
                        Technical Service Provider Training Program
                    A multi-partner coordinated effort to enhance conservation delivery in California.
                        On-Farm Research
                    
                    		    		
    		                BEAM compost in rangelands, no-till organic cropping systems.
    
                        RAD-Lab and SPA
                    
                    		    		
    		                Learn about our soil processing and testing services.
    
                        Mentor Farmers & RA Demos
                    
                    		    		
    		                Demonstration sites and farmer case studies.
    
                        Resources
                    
                    		    		
    		                Scientific literature, seminar videos, carbon farm planning, funding resources for producers, reading list, and other resources.
    
                        Blog
                    
                    		    		
    		                A blog for the layperson about regenerative agriculture
    
                        CSU Journal of Sustainability and Climate Change
                    
                    		    		
    		                Original peer-reviewed research.
    CSU, Chico is1 of only 4 CSUs with a farmNo. 1 sustainable farmHome to the only college organic dairy in the WestNamed the greenest school in the 23-campus CSU by Sierra Club
We acknowledge and are mindful that Chico State stands on lands that were originally occupied by the first people of this area, Mechoopda, and we recognize their distinctive spiritual relationship with this land, the flora, the fauna, and the waters that run through campus. We are humbled that our campus resides upon sacred lands that since time immemorial have sustained the Mechoopda people and continue to do so today.Contact UsNeed Help?FacebookFacebookTwitterTwitterInstagramInstagramReport an accessibility issueReport a broken link on this pageTitle IXPrivacy PolicyCalifornia State University, Chico400 West First StreetChico, CA 95929Copyright © 2023 All Rights Reserved
